newsitem.title: USA: AST to cut jobs 25 pct, take Q2 charge.
newsitem.headline: AST to cut jobs 25 pct, take Q2 charge.

text.p: AST Research Inc said Monday that in response to lower-than-anticipated first quarter results, it plans to reduce its worldwide work force by about 25 percent.
The company said it expects to take a related charge of about $12 million during the second quarter.
AST reported a first quarter loss of $1.90 a share, compared with a loss of $2.59 a share a year earlier.

The company said first quarter results were hurt by lower demand, including an accelerated competitive pricing environment and a product transition period in its commercial desktop and notebook product lines.

AST said results were also hurt by customer uncertainty surrounding a proposal for Samsung Electronics Co Ltd to acquire all outstanding common stock of AST not currently owned by Samsung or its affiliates.
On April 15 AST and Samsung announced a definitive agreement for Samsung to begin a tender offer for all outstanding AST shares at $5.40 cash each.
